text: Hi everyone I was trying to make a table within a CRM Card horizontal scrollable, because I have a lot of columns to show, but for now I only get columns only as wide as the CRM Card and everything was clinched like in this pic. Has anyone a solution for me?
Thanks for the reply, I'll check that :)

I am trying to implement a CRM card extension that needs to communicate with a third party API system. I can either have the customer sign in with their credentials to generate a JWT token or use an SSO call to get the oauth token. My question is how do I persist this token so the user doesn't always have to login / initiate SSO request?
:saluting_face:
use `width="min"`
it forces `white-space: no-wrap` and will keep things looking good :+1:
You could store that token in a database but currently there is no way to permanently store data in a CRM card
I'd have to setup an additional infra just to map the HubSpot portal to the third party system. I read an old post about adding third party oauth support which was 3 years ago, any updates on that?

do you have that post? Would definitely be very interested to read it, but yes to handle additional authentication you need additional infra. You could build it out with something like <http://nango.dev|nango.dev> for the api auth, and then you just use the nago api to get the auth creds each time. <https://docs.nango.dev/guides/oauth>
hmm, does MultiSelect also have a different directory it needs to be imported from? Getting a can't resolve symbol when trying to import it from @HubSpot/ui-extensions
Input and everything else imports fine

and this is what index.d.ts shows as exportable:

```export { Alert, Button, ButtonRow, Card, DescriptionList, DescriptionListItem, Divider, EmptyState, ErrorState, Form, Heading, Image, Input, LoadingSpinner, ProgressBar, Select, Stack, Statistics, StatisticsItem, StatisticsTrend, Table, TableFooter, TableCell, TableRow, TableBody, TableHeader, TableHead, Tag, Text, Textarea, Tile, ToggleGroup, Link, NumberInput, Box, } from './coreComponents';```
which I don't see in there

Hi <@U04N6N424MB> :wave:, could you tell me which version of `@HubSpot/ui-extenions` you are using?  I just double checked the most recent version `7.3.0` on my machine and `MultiSelect` is available in that version.
Hey there! How do you tell the version of that, I don't see it in package.json
oh duh didn't even look at the subfolder package-locks
What is the output of `npm list` ran from the `src/app/extensions` directory? You might need to run an `npm update @HubSpot/ui-extensions` to get the most recent

```npm list
getting-started@0.1.0 C:\\reactCards\pricingInventory
`-- (empty)


 npm update @HubSpot/ui-extensions

up to date, audited 1 package in 63ms

found 0 vulnerabilities```
heres the output of the two; looks like Flex is missing also
this is a project from the early beta
Is that being ran in the `src/app/extensions` directory?
nah let me try that

```+-- @HubSpot/ui-extensions-dev-server@0.1.0
+-- @HubSpot/ui-extensions@0.1.0
`-- react@18.2.0```
so thats prob why lol
Oh yeah, we're going to need to update that `@HubSpot/ui-extensions` for sure
yeah lol
If you run `npm update @HubSpot/ui-extensions` and then `npm list` do you get version `7.3.0`?
yep :slightly_smiling_face:  seems to work now thank you
Awesome!  Glad I could help
:saluting_face: ty

Hi :wave: - I am trying to create a HubSpot react app so that I can enable our operators to perform tasks from the HubSpot UI

I was having some trouble getting started and wondering if there was a getting started guide I should use: I tried using the `hs project create` and used the CRM getting started project and I got an error when trying to run `hs upload`:
`- $.data.fetch: is missing but it is required`

 I was trying to follow the guide located here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-a-project> and it would not let me upload an empty project either.
What output do you get from `hs --version` ?
Thanks! I am going to test something out now :brb:

Is it possible to send me a zip file of the directory?

I just ran through these steps and it succeeded, so using the same source code as you might help me narrow in on the issue:

```‚ùØ hs --version
5.0.2-beta.0

‚ùØ hs project upload
? The project bug--data-fetch-config does not exist in uix (_______). Would you like to create it? Yes
[SUCCESS] New project bug--data-fetch-config successfully created in uix (_______).
‚úì Uploaded bug--data-fetch-config project files to uix (_______)

View build #1 in HubSpot

‚úì Built bug--data-fetch-config #1
  ‚úì Building Get started App [private app] ... DONE

--------------------------------------------------
Build #1 succeeded. Automatically deploying to uix (______)


View deploy of build #1 in HubSpot

‚úì Deployed build #1 in bug--data-fetch-config
  ‚úì Deploying Get started App [private app] ... DONE```
Can do, give me one minute
<@U01NMMDTERZ>
<@U05TTKQ4G3Z> can you DM me your portal ID? I will verify if everything is configured properly (e.g. make sure you're signed up for the beta feature, etc)
Because uploading that directory worked for me as well
For posterity: once Nolan signed up for the beta, things seem to be working as expected :pray:
